title: 104_hr1266
content: The Act is titled the "Greens Creek Land Exchange Act of 1995" and includes findings. The Congress found that the Greens Creek Claims were established under the Alaska National Interest Lands Conservation Act, with special provisions for development. Kennecott Greens Creek Mining Company holds the claims, and negotiations with the Forest Service allow for exploration while protecting the Admiralty Island National Monument. The Congress found that the Greens Creek Claims were established under the Alaska National Interest Lands Conservation Act, with special provisions for development by Kennecott Greens Creek Mining Company. The Agreement for exploration must be approved and ratified by Congress to protect the values of the Admiralty Island National Monument. SEC. 3. DEFINITIONS. In this Act, key terms such as "Agreement," "ANILCA," "conservation system unit," "Greens Creek Claims," "KGCMC," and "Monument" are defined. The term "Monument" refers to the Admiralty Island National Monument in Alaska. "Royalty" is defined as Net Island Receipts Royalty, and "Secretary" refers to the Secretary of Agriculture. SEC. 4. RATIFICATION OF THE AGREEMENT. The Agreement is ratified and confirmed for the duties and obligations of the United States, KGCMC, and Kennecott Corporation. Modifications can be made with written agreement from all parties and notification to Congress committees. SEC. 5. IMPLEMENTATION OF THE AGREEMENT. The Secretary is authorized to acquire lands within conservation units in the Tongass National Forest, to be administered as part of the National Forest System. A special account called the "Greens Creek Land Exchange Account" will receive royalties for land acquisition funding. The Secretary of Agriculture is authorized to implement and administer the Federal Government's rights and obligations under the Agreement, including monitoring. Royalties paid to the United States under the Agreement are subject to distribution provisions for roads and schools. Lands conveyed to KGCMC are available for mining activities in accordance with the Agreement. The Secretary of Agriculture is authorized to implement and administer the Federal Government's rights and obligations under the Agreement, including monitoring, collecting royalties, and conducting audits. KGCMC properties on Admiralty Island will revert to the United States, with properties within the Monument becoming part of it and those outside managed as part of the Tongass National Forest. Implementation of the Agreement shall not be considered a major Federal action. Implementation of this Act will not be considered a major Federal action affecting the environment or require further consideration under other laws. SEC. 6. RECISION RIGHTS. KGCMC and Kennecott Corporation have the right to rescind all rights under the Agreement and this Act within 60 days of enactment. Rescission requires a resolution from the Board of Directors and must be delivered to the Chief of the Forest Service in Washington, D.C. If rescinded, the Agreement's original provisions will apply.
